1517335328_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnX.body:
Adnauseam (Ad blocker and auto ad clicker)
Trackmenot (makes random searches to obfuscate data)
HTTPS Everywhere (redirects non-https websites to HTTPS)
uMatrix (fine grained control of JS, and external requests)
Decentraleyes (CDN emulation on the local level)
Greasemonkey and the following scripts:
-4chan X: Various enhancements to 4Chan
-Viewtube: Redirects normal videos to easily downloadable formats
-Viewtube X for porn: Viewtube for porn
-Youtube +: Various youtube enhancements.
Stylish

Best list I could figure.

1518871624_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnX.body:
Tixati is definitively my favorite on Winblows. 

On Linux the real choice is really just Rtorrent, it's the sole one properly optimized anyways.

1521022489_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnX.body:
> [nekololi](#comment_5_1FzZsDQdh8wk71bDLxURPzmAt2FXehoNAB): firefox's rss handler does not notify you when there are changes in a site. rss works, and you can view entries to a feed from bookmarks, however, when a new entry to an rss feed is found, there are no notifications to alert you of it. it will just silently appear in the feed. for notifications, you will need to find a good addon.

InfoRSS reloaded was decent for old firefox.
New firefox I can't tell tbh. Thunderbird is my RSS feed reader personally
